DataElement.preferredName: Investigational New Drug Investigational Medical Device Receive Or Trial Participation Prior To Treatment Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a patient to participate in a clinical study related to IND/IDE receipt or clinical trial participation prior to treatment occurrence.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Investigational New Drug Investigational Medical Device Receive Or Clinical Trial Participation Prior To Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes._A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy._To take, accept, or get something offered._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes._The act of taking part in an activity._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Investigational New Drug Investigational Medical Device Receive
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.:A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.:To take, accept, or get something offered.

Concepts.definition: A new drug or biological drug that is used in a clinical investigation. The term also includes a biological product that is used in vitro for diagnostic purposes.

A device that is the subject of clinical investigation or research to determine the safety or effectiveness of the device. Investigational devices include transitional devices (21 CFR 812.3(r)) that are objects of investigations. An investigational device may be an approved device that is being studied for an unapproved use or efficacy.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

Property.preferredName: Or Clinical Trial Participation Prior To Therapeutic Procedure Occurrence Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.:The act of taking part in an activity.:Earlier in time or order.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A research study that prospectively assigns human participants or groups of humans to one or more health-related interventions to evaluate the effects on health outcomes.
The act of taking part in an activity.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is patient currently receivin
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving any other investigational agents or has participated in a study of an investigational agent or using an investigational device within 2 weeks of the first dose of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received an investigational agent or has used an investigational device within 4 weeks prior to the first dose of study drug?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently receiving any other investigational agents or has participated in a study of an investigational agent or using an investigational device within 5 half-lives of the compound or 3 months, whichever is greater?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently participating and receiving study therapy or has participated in a study of an investigational agent and received study therapy or used an investigational device within 4 weeks of the first dose of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently participating in or has participated in a study of an investigational agent or using an investigational device within 4 weeks of the first dose of trial treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently participating and receiving study therapy or have participated in a study of an investigational agent and received study therapy or used an investigational device within 4 weeks of the first dose of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient currently participating and receiving study therapy or has participated in a study of an investigational agent and received study therapy or used an investigational device within 4 weeks of the first dose of treatment?
